file_content.text: Good luck. Without you, this could have been a strategic failure.
Let's hear the whole situation. And don't soften any bad news.
Where? And how many?
I just assumed we were all coming from the same place. If House Organa falls, it's the end of the Republic on Alderaan.
If you have a strategy, don't keep it just for yourself.
So how do we stop them?
We're going to give them a special delivery. It will be neither kind nor pretty. Ordnance jobs never are.
Thul serves the Empire. I'll stop every one individually if I have to.
I consider it my duty.
I can be distracting.
I might be able to help.
Let's do it.
That's a little presumptuous.
My apologies.
Apologies, Master Jedi.
I'm truly sorry, sir.
No offense meant.
There are still Thuls down there if you want to mop up.
The Thuls cannot be allowed to get past us.
Whoa, listen to that comm chatter. Guess the Thuls picked up a little profanity while they were in exile.
We need someone with the flash and power to distract the Thuls and cover our men as they work.
General Kashim says you've got flash and power. We need someone like you to distract the Thuls while we plant the charges.
I've no doubt you can get the Thuls' attention.
The main priority is that he stays alive and gets those charges laid. Kill the Thuls, distract them, I don't care.
I am Master Sergeant Volere, and I will skip the pleasantries. Thul special operations soldiers are deploying as we speak.
Let me brief you. The Thul spec ops teams are coming from troop transports offshore. If they deploy everyone, we're in it deep.
Hammering individual soldiers won't work--we have to take the offense against those ships now.
I can take on a ship.
No need to engage them directly. Each of my men here are carrying about twenty kilograms of high explosives.
Fight a whole troop transport?
Hear me out. These men are all the explosives experts we could scramble on such short notice.
That's a nice fantasy, but counter to our objective.
The plan is to rig the Thuls' scout crafts and let them return to their command ship. Then we perform the detonation remotely.
Their landing craft riddle the beaches, and High Command expects us to repel them. Are you ready to go in?
I will help, but the Jedi Code frowns on such cold-blooded slaughter.
If that's the only way.
It's a dirty trick, sure, but one that will keep us from waking up with the enemy in our homes.
Low risk. High yield. I approve.
A solid plan.
Thank your generals when you get back home. Our officers get Republic training.
They're sure to notice the tampering on the crafts.
Won't work. [Refuse quest]
Then go down alone and try to clear that beach. See how far you get.
I'll be moving on.
We'll stay here until we can get reinforcements and take out the ones on the coast.
And Command is planning to set up a base here to repel future attacks.
It seemed underhanded.
It was unpleasant work.
Born of desperation. If we lost this beach, the Organa estate would soon follow.
Every Thul on that ship was sworn to kill anyone loyal to the Republic.
Remember that if you feel a speck of shame.
What about their invasion? Did we succeed?
Job well done?
They're calling it off! Retreating back to their medical ships behind Thul lines!
They've got special ops teams on the beach, and it gets worse.
The Thul spec ops teams come from troop transports just offshore. The transports are getting intel from the beachhead for an invasion.
We'll split into teams. My explosives specialist here will go with you.
When he's done, get out. We wouldn't mind a few survivors to take our surprise back to the transport.
Escort my man to the boats. Keep the Thuls away--drive them off, kill them, whatever. Laying the charges is the priority.
Good timing. Two of the landing craft just returned to the troop transports.
Are you ready? Like the famous last words say, "let's see what this button does."
Don't pay attention to me! Cover your man!
There are still a few Ulgos out there, if you're looking for some exercise.
Listen to that comm chatter. I didn't know nobles could use language like that.
With the intel erased and their scanners destroyed, the Ulgos won't be sending anything but distress calls.
You came through just when we needed you. I'll make sure the rest of Alderaan hears about it.
Hit those Ulgos hard. Then our men will show them some real fireworks.
None of my men are up to this. We're going to need some real firepower here, someone tough....
Or a bunch of someones. Squad like you could take on the entire Ulgo army.
Master Jedi. I'm sure your mission here is important, but we need help.
Havoc Squad! I don't mean to interrupt, but House Organa could use your assistance.
Hold there! You're that merc, aren't you? The one command's been talking about. You're hired.
Lieutenant Obatt. And this is Master Sergeant Volere. I'll skip the pleasantries. Ulgo special ops soldiers are deploying as we speak.
We should evacuate!
The Republic didn't come to Alderaan for a rescue mission. We mean to help Organa win.
You're soldiers too.
You're soldiers too.
Ulgo's not here to attack-- not yet. From what we can tell, they're mostly gathering intel, preparing for a full-scale invasion later.
The long-range scanners they've set up can detect every move we make. We can't let that intel get back to Ulgo command.
Just give me your orders.
Thank you. We're counting on your assistance to make this plan work.
Don't bring me into this.
You'll get hazard pay for your trouble, if that's what you want. Just hear us out.
Our operatives will erase the data from the long-range scanners, then down the towers with explosives so Ulgo can never use them again.
General Kashim says you've got flash and power. We need you to distract the Ulgos while our man plants the charges.
We need someone with flash and power to distract the Ulgos and cover our men as they work.
I would be honored.
I'm all about flash.
I've no doubt you can get the Ulgos' attention.
The coordinates to the Ulgo recon camp. Once you've reached the area, signal our explosives man and his escort.
We'll only get one shot at this. Hold out as long as you can until those charges are set.
Too busy, sorry. [Refuse quest]
Fine. Just don't be surprised when House Ulgo has us surrounded.
Sorry, can't spare the time. The Ulgos have gotten too close for comfort.
Captain! Sir, I don't mean to interrupt, but House Organa could use your assistance.
